news.title: Nikita Hand to sue her two former neighbours and Conor McGregor over withdrawn claims in failed appeal
news.summary: Nikita Hand has initiated new proceedings against Conor McGregor and two would-be witnesses whose evidence was dramatically withdrawn from the mixed martial arts fighter’s failed appeal.

news.title: ‘We will never give up searching for Fiona’ – 27 years later Sinnott family seeks answers
news.summary: Yesterday, in a sleepy south Wexford village, the Sinnott family were keeping a vigil.

news.title: ‘Sitting in a deckchair wouldn’t cause fear’ – trespassing case against grandfather (84) dismissed
news.summary: An elderly man who gathered with friends on a green area that is a designated public space has had a trespassing case against him dismissed.

news.title: ‘I was delighted until I read the note – the flowers were for someone else’: What happens when you find out your partner is cheating?
news.summary: Andy Byron and Kristin Cabot were made instant, albeit undoubtedly unwilling, internet stars when they were captured in a cosy embrace while watching the concert.

news.title: Water shortages could hit Dublin, Wicklow and Kildare as ‘critical and complex’ repairs begin tonight
news.summary: Uisce Éireann has warned customers in Dublin, Kildare and Wicklow of potential water shortages this weekend as the company commences “critical and complex” repairs tonight.

news.title: ‘I just knew Ronan O’Gara would bring something really special to rugby broadcasting’
news.summary: Miles Harrison cannot remember the words he used to describe Hugo Keenan’s last-gasp try that sealed the series-winning victory over Australia in Melbourne last Saturday. But what stays with him was the silence that followed in the Sky Sports commentary box.

news.title: ‘I remember Bono warning me not to touch cocaine – but it was too late’: Anthony Kavanagh on addiction, Stephen Gately and hiding his sexuality
news.summary: Anthony Kavanagh, known more readily as the UK pop singer Kavana, recalls the moment he met Bono in the VIP section of Brown’s nightclub in London.

news.title: Are Liam and Pam really dating? We investigate if there is any truth to the ‘Naked Gun’ romance rumours
news.summary: At 6pm on July 22, Pamela Anderson kissed her  Naked Gun  co-star Liam Neeson on the cheek at the film’s red carpet premiere in London.

news.title: Not just Justin Timberlake: Why do so many celebrities have Lyme disease and how can we avoid tick bites?
news.summary: Justin Timberlake has revealed that he is living with Lyme disease after a shock diagnosis.

news.title: Lucinda O’Sullivan’s reviews on the road: The best of the best spots to eat in the West – from Connemara to Galway city
news.summary: August is the month when city folk take to the hills or seashores. New Yorkers head to the Hamptons, Spaniards to the Balearics. Parisians to the Cote d’Azur, Corkonians to Baltimore. Dubs to the waters and wilds of various corners of this small island.
